botanical_details.genus: Pelargonium can be perennials, sub-shrubs or shrubs, sometimes succulent and mostly evergreen, with palmately lobed or pinnately divided leaves and clusters of slightly irregular, 5-petalled flowers
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Angel pelargoniums are compact, bushy perennials with small, rounded leaves, sometimes scented, and clusters of small single flowers in shades of pink, red purple or white

how_to_grow.cultivation: Best grown in pots. May be grown outdoors once risk of frost is passed. Feed in summer with high potash fertiliser to encourage flowering. See pelargonium cultivation
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by softwood cuttings in spring or summer
how_to_grow.pruning: Deadhead regularly to encourage more flowers. Cut back in autumn if overwintering old plants
how_to_grow.pests: Generally trouble-free, but may be susceptible to aphids in spring
how_to_grow.diseases: Generally trouble-free, but may be susceptible to pelargonium rust and Pelargonium viruses
